How to Criticize with Kindness: Philosopher Daniel Dennett on the 4 Steps to Arguing Intelligently http://t.co/vN3twRIbb1 via @username
1. You should attempt to re-express your target’s position so clearly, vividly, and fairly that your target says. DD
2. You should list any points of agreement (especially if they are not matters of general or widespread agreement). DD
3. You should mention anything you have learned from your target. DD
4. Only then are you permitted to say so much as a word of rebuttal or criticism. DD
